required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Evaluate ATP-induced Pain and ATP-induced Dermal Vasodilation by Iontophoresis (0000-118)(COMPLETED)
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double Blind, Placebo Controlled, Crossover Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Effects of ATP-Induced Pain (AIP) and ATP-induced Dermal Vasodilation (AIDV) by Iontophoresis in Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate ATP-induced Pain (AIP) and ATP-induced dermal vasodilation (AIDV) as target engagement tools for future development of analgesics.

primary_outcome.measure: Degree of pain induced by ATP vs. saline iontophoresis
Increase in blood flow induced by ATP iontophoresis

secondary_outcome.measure: Test-retest reproducibility and intra-subject variability of AIP and AIDV

intervention.intervention_name: Comparator: Iontophoresis and Laser Doppler with ATP
intervention.description: Iontophoresis treatments with 10 mM ATP (adenosine triphosphate) solution and a current of 0.8 or 1.2 mA. Iontophoresis treatments will last 4 minutes. Laser doppler will be used during the iontophoresis treatments to measure dermal blood flow.

intervention.intervention_name: Comparator: Iontophoresis and Laser Doppler with Saline
intervention.description: Iontophoresis treatments with 20 mM saline solution and a current of 0.8 or 1.2 mA. Iontophoresis treatments will last 4 minutes. Laser doppler will be used during the iontophoresis treatments to measure dermal blood flow.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject is in generally good health
- Subject is willing to abstain from smoking within 24 hours of each iontophoresis treatment and limit smoking to 5 or less cigarettes per week during the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject has a history of dermatitis, psoriasis, or eczema
- Subject has active asthma and/or hay fever at the time of the screening visit
- Subject is unable to refrain from use of analgesics within 3 days prior to each treatment period
